roleset.name: to amuse or charm

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: But each time I chanced a return with trepidation, I was beguiled by some other wonderful dish: chunks of tender beef with crunchy walnuts, a spicy, verdant fish stew, tiny cold clams with garlic chives, and several times, pickled celtuce, a root vegetable that is a cross between knob celery and lettuce.
example.arg: each time I chanced a return with trepidation,

by some other wonderful dish: chunks of tender beef with crunchy walnuts, a spicy, verdant fish stew, tiny cold clams with garlic chives, and several times, pickled celtuce, a root vegetable that is a cross between knob celery and lettuce.

roleset.note: BEGUILE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'beguile' based on internet usage examples, membership in VN. Verbnet entry 31.1, comparison with 'amuse,' 'cheat.' (from beguile.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: deprive, cheat someone out of something

example.name: all args
example.text: Mary beguiled John of his money.

roleset.note: BEGUILE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'beguile' based on internet usage examples, membership in VN. Verbnet entry 31.1, comparison with 'amuse,' 'cheat.' (from beguile.02-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: deceive

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: He woos fame as if she were a woman, then pretends, when he has beguiled her into his bed, he isn't sure she suits him.

roleset.note: BEGUILE-V NOTES: Frame by Claire (from beguile.03-v)
